turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Come back some other time, will you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Yeah, sure. Good luck.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Come on, Pop.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Nothing you can do. Been like this for days.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Want to come up the house? You can stay there till you get on your feet. There's no point paying a hotel.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No thanks, Lee.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: It's just that I hate empty rooms.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Well, what're you going to do?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I guess I'll make me some trouble in that town.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Going back, huh?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: They'll run you out.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: No, they won't.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: How 'you gonna live?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I can always chop cotton if I have to.  If you want a ride, I'll take you home.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No, thanks. I'll take the bus.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Don't be too hard on him.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Hell, I'm just like him.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: I know he wasn't much of a father.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Who is?!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Good-bye, Duff.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: How are you?

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: All right, son.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: It's hard to know how to talk to the white folks these days.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Guess it's never been easy.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: It's a changing time. Sit down, son.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Well, it looks like we'll be getting our new school.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: How come you all ain't sendin' them to the same school?

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Well, you've got to go easy. We haven't had any trouble in town for eight years, and we're not going to have any now.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Can't live without trouble, can you?  Nice place you got here. Real nice.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Yes, the Lord's been pretty good to us. I guess you're a church man, aren't you?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I guess I ain't.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Why? Don't you believe in the Lord?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Aw, I do. But 'seems to me us colored folks do a whole lot of church-goin'. It's the whites that need it real bad.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I think if you tried livin' in a town like this, instead of running free and easy, you'd soon change your tune.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I doubt it.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I see.  Well, I guess we don't have much to say to each other.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: And since we're talking, my wife and I don't want you hanging around our daughter.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, that figures.  Kind of fits in with everything else, don't it!

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I know just how you feel, son. But believe me, you're going about it the wrong way.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Don't look like there's a right way.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Well, you have to be reasonable. Now they say you're a troublemaker. That's no good. Use a little psychology. Make 'em think you're going along - and get what you want.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: It ain't in me.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: You'll be in trouble, son.  Now just how do you intend to support your family?

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: I guess I'll rob a bank.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Don't you get smart with me, boy.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: So I been told.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: It's for your own good.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Oh yeah?  Seems to me, Reverend, you' more concerned 'bout your good. Guess it looks kind 'a bad, havin' me for a son-in-law.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: You can be cocky now, boy. But you won't make it. You won't last. I just feel sorry for Josie. I knew it wouldn't work out.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Well, at least she ain't married to no white man's nigger! You been stoopin' so long, Reverend, you don't even know how to stand straight no more. You' just half a man!

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: Maybe I could talk to Bud Ellis. He might have a job for you at his filling station.

turns.speaker: DUFF
turns.text: Oh yeah?

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I'll be seeing you.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Why don't you guys buy your own?

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: 'Oughta give up smoking, Jocko.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Man, you won't like that back seat.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Man, why 'you messin' around with a gal like that? You won't get no place.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Hell, they're all after the same thing.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Well, if it ain't Duff!

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: How you doin'?  Hi there!

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: I'll be a monkey's kid sister! What d'you want to do a thing like that for?

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: 'Musta knocked her up.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: What're you gonna get out of it, huh?

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Ol' Doris sure goin' to miss you.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: Just give him a couple of months. A girl like that, she don't know any tricks.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: You know what Doris told me? She say: That Duff's a nice guy. Wouldn't even charge him nothin'.

turns.speaker: FRANKIE
turns.text: I guess you'll be quittin' the railroad, huh, man?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Yeah. All a colored woman wants is your money.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: What d'you know about women, Pop?

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Well, I got married to one of them.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Hell, I didn't know you was married.

turns.speaker: POP
turns.text: Sure. Got a sixteen-year-old girl.

turns.speaker: JOCKO
turns.text: Is that right?  Think you're gonna make it with her?

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: So you're courtin' the preacher's girl. Well, just watch your step, boy, or he'll preach you right into hell.  I'm counting on you, Reverend.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: Wouldn't do for one of your people to sue at a time like this.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: JOHNSON
turns.text: I'll talk to the Mayor.

turns.speaker: REVEREND DAWSON
turns.text: That'll make the folks very happy.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Baby - want you to meet Duff.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He's my son!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Come on, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What's the matter?! You mad at me?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: No. Why?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Nothin'.  She's all right. Wouldn't have made it without her. Christ - haven't worked in eight months. Right now, I'm waitin' for some insurance money. And man, when I get it, I got plans to make me some more.  Let's get out'a here. This place gives me the willies.  You got some money?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Let's stay here, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What's the matter?! It's a celebration!

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Pour your own trouble, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Your mother used to lay for her boss, boy. Did you know that?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Shut up, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Okay, so what's a girl supposed to do? Me not workin' and her cleanin' house for a white man. I'm tellin' you, boy, keep away from marriage. Ya gotta stay light on your feet or you won't make it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Is she good in the hay? No point marryin' her just to find out. Is there, baby?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: If you don't quit it, Will, I'm leaving.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You're breaking my heart.  Got to see a man about a dog.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: He's your son.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Okay, boy, beat it.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Now you stay put!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I ain't drunk, honey.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Like hell you ain't!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Got a thick feelin' here.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: What's the matter now?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Better now.  Where 'you at?

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: LEE
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Anything you say, baby.

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: I fucking hate Raoul.  Shut the fuck up, asshole! someone.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: You hate Raoul?

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: Sometimes.  And sometimes I don't--  Shut the fuck up!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Your Raoul?

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: Sometimes, I want to blow his fucking brains out!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Omar--

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: Danny, I can't fucking wait anymore.  You hear me? Now where the fuck's my wife?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: She's coming, Omar, she's coming--

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: I want my wife.  I told you and told you. Now I'm gettin' tired of this shit--

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Omar, listen to me--

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: No more goddamn talking!  I want the bitch or I'm gonna do the girl!

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: I'm sorry, Danny. Time's up. I'11 do the girl, then me. I don't give a fuck.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Don't give her the satisfaction.  Your wife is on her way...

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: Enough talking!  We been talking for eleven fucking hours, man.  My throat's fucking raw!

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Omar, your wife's here.  Ny superiors: will allow me to make the trade now.  But I gotta see that you haven't hurt the other hostages.  If you haven't, I'11 take the girl and send in your wife.

turns.speaker: OMAR
turns.text: Nice and slow. You come in. Get a look around.  Then I get my wife.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Beck's just put us on standby for crisis entry.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: That's not the play.  Omar'll get a shot off.  I can still talk to him, Nate, I just need time.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Nathan to HBT 1.  Negotiator is requesting more time.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Whoa.  No way.  You can't enter the kill zone.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: Since when?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Since you got married.  You got someone else to think about now, Danny.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: How long's it been?

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I'm still on my honeymoon.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: So don't pull this cowboy shit now. You'll give him a target.  You'll get yourself killed.  Just keep talking.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: I will.  Inside.  There's no other way to get the gun off the girl's head, Nate.

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Negotiator entering Kill Zone.

turns.speaker: DANNY
turns.text: We got any shots?

turns.speaker: NATHAN
turns.text: Bathroom. But he's nowhere near it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Oh my God, I'm terribly sorry. Did I hurt you?

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Let me get you another glass of wine.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: I've had quite enough or I wouldn't be playing such games with beautiful strangers. Aren't Peter's illusions to your liking?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: They're a bit too real for my taste. Will you excuse me for a moment?

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: Peter said you came to kill us. Is that true?

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: No. I only needed the code from you.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: Then we would have talked, you and I.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Take this off.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: He wants to kill you, you know... Perhaps I won't allow it.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Don't play with me.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: You didn't come here to destroy Wintermute. You can to save a man you love. A man who isn't even capable of returning that love. Such a waste...

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: My man's coming to get my ass out of here. That's good enough for me.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: Pity. Then you'll both have to die.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: She's very striking, don't you think? Are these glasses a fashion where she comes from?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: She was prettier before she tarted herself up with the hardware.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: Security breach. Perhaps her friends have come to join our party.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Splendid. We'll prepare a welcome for them.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: You're hurt...

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: It's nothing. C'mon... we've got to transfer those funds and get the hell out of here.

turns.speaker: 3JANE
turns.text: What about her?

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Of course...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What are you doing in here?

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: The Elders, mon...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Can you get us into Straylight?

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: Gettin' in is easy. It's getting out I'm thinkin' of.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: If there's a Babylon, man, that's it. We leave her in there, she ain't comin' out, steppin' razor or not.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'm getting used to it. Where are we?

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: Straylight. Kitchen dock.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What the hell is that?

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: Skeleton key. This opens the gates of Babylon.

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: What you lookin' for, mon?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: A place to tap in. I can scramble that signal before this place is crawling with guardsmen.

turns.speaker: AEROL
turns.text: Ghost a steppin' razor...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: No. Just Riviera trying to fuck with our heads. They're close. Very close.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: Easy...

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Play it straight with me and you've got nothing to worry about. When it's over, I inject you with the antitoxin.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: What's an A.I.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: An Artificial Intelligence. A computer system that's developed the capacity for sentient thought. They're dangerous and totally unpredictable.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: A little incestuous, but at least it's original. Who's the guy in the halloween costume?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: He's a vat grown Ninja, the Royal Family's bodyguard. Watch out for him, he's no joke.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: We did a pretty good job of pissing them off.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: They're only guessing, but we can't take any risks.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: The Villa Straylight. Home of the Royal Family and the mainframe of the computer entity we know as Wintermute. If we can get Molly in, she can access the mainframe to cripple Mute's defences, the Case can destroy it in Cyberspace.

turns.speaker: MOLLY
turns.text: How's the villa's security?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Excellent, but that's where Peter come in. 3Jane is having a dinner party tomorrow night. Peter will simply escort Molly to the villa. Once she's in... Case will guide her to the mainframe in link mode.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Alright. Let's talk business.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Those are all your records. I can have you cleared on all counts. Possession. ...Contributing to the delinquency of minors... Statutory rape.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: I was set up.  She looked at least eighteen.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You get us access to the Tessier's computer and you can return to Earth anytime you want. A free man.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Your gun, your prints. The Tessiers might overlook a little child molesting, but murder's bad P.R., Mr. Riviera. I suggest to reconsider my offer.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: You son-of-a-bitch, you're crazy.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Then you'll have to persuade her to tell it to you.

turns.speaker: RIVIERA
turns.text: And how do you suggest I do that?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Are you sure you're up to this, Mr. Case? We could reconvene tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You've got an expensive razor girl on me for a reason. I'd like to hear what it is.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: The corporate plundering of Yeshoto Industries... At first these seemed like unrelated incidents, but a pattern is emerging that suggests otherwise.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What does this have to do with me?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Our analysis of the London stock crash suggest that it was manipulated from within the international computer matrix. Cyberspace, Mr. Case... A realm I believe you're familiar with.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Put the Sense/Net Police on it. The matrix is their turf.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Sense/Net's corporately financed. Too corrupt to be trusted. You of all people should know that.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: If someone is infiltrating the matrix on a global scale no political or economic system is safe. I'm assembling a team of specialists, Mr. Case. We need a man who can enter the matrix and trace this saboteur.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: My days of punching deck are over. For you or anybody else.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: What would you say if I told you we could correct your neural damage?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I'd say you were full of shit.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then I'd ask you what your terms are.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: First, let's get something straight. We ran a psych construct on you that lists self destruction as your favourite pastime. If you want to kill yourself, Mr. Case, there's much more entertaining ways than working for me.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It's the people close to me that tend to die... and I get the feeling you and I are going to be real buddies.  Terms?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: We'll match your rate just prior to your... accident. One half in advance.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Who's running the show, Armitage? This a government sting?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Questions make me nervous. Part of our arrangement will be that you don't ask too many.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: I'll think you'll find everything in working order. Molly's just having a little fun.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I don't call this fun, pal. You're playing God with my body.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You're a substance abuser, Case. Your pancreas was shot. Wouldn't have lasted out the year. We did you a favour and liberated you from a dangerous dependency in the bargain.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Thanks, but I was enjoying that dependency.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Good, because you've got a new one.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: There are fifteen toxin sacs bonded to the lining of your main arteries. They're dissolving, Case... slowly, but they're definitely dissolving. You have just long enough to do the job.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You son of a bitch...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Why'd you do it, Armitage?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: The disturbance in cyberspace... It's an A.I.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Right. And no one would take on an A.I.... If they had a choice.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: First sign of free will, Sense/Net usually slags 'em.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: This one's different. No one can trace it. It's out there somewhere in the matrix and it's growing stronger... infecting other computer systems like a virus.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Anything rated higher than a P.C.'s got a hard-wired suicide switch. It'll self- destruct.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: It hasn't yet.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I've heard about rogue A.I.'s, but there's only one guy who actually went up against one.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Dixie McCoy

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Right. Best cowboy that ever punched deck. The old man taught me most of what I know.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: I've arranged for him to work with us.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: That's gonna be tough because Dixie McCoy's dead. The A.I. flatlined him.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: I know.  You ever work with ghosts, Case?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Sense/Net taped a full spectrum personality construct on McCoy six months before his death. Everything Dixie was -- everything Dixie still knows exists as a digitised construct.  Of course a tape can get misplaced in a library the size of Sense/Net's.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Working with a dead man. Shit, I've done about everything else.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You'll be ready for a trial run in two days. If your splices hold, you'll use McCoy to trace the A.I.'s coordinates.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: And then?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Then we rendezvous with the final member of our team. For now, that's all you need to know.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It's just that sometimes I wonder what team I'm playin' on.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You ran without us.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I cannot tell a lie. Sorry.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Sorry, bullshit. We haven't even begun and you're already jeopardising this operation.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What's he doing to my gear?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Could be your A.I.'s calling card.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Did you trace it?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: No, but it traced me.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Fried Air Tram in the process. Not to mention half my gear.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: What about McCoy?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: He's got a little attitude problem, being that he's dead and all, but he'll come around. Where's Molly?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Prepping your trip.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Really? Do I get to know where I'm going? It makes packing so much easier.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Offworld. The A.I.... this "Wintermute" thing evolved on a computer mainframe on the satellite Freeside. If you attack it from within the matrix while Molly accesses its original programming we can cripple its defence systems.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: That could work, but the timing will be a bitch.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You'll be linked during the entire operation.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Linked?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Yeah, well it's working.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Stick with her. I want the process to become second nature to you. We fly for Freeside at dawn.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Let's hope she doesn't expect me to swim upstream.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You see the couple up in the balcony?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: That's Lord Frederick Tessier. Owns most of Freeside. Wintermute's mainframe is centred in the Royal Family's villa.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: He's a Sense/Net Chairman. Why would he launch an A.I.?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Good question. He may not have intended to. The girl in question is Lady 3Jane. She's very important to us. The third clone of Lady Jane Tessier.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The old man cheats on his wife with her own clone?

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Lady Tessier is frigid. Can't stand his touch. So she had herself cloned. The marriage stays intact and the clones take care of her wifely duties. 3Jane's his favourite.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: That's nice, but we can't dodge this kind of heat for long.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: We won't have to. The run is tomorrow night.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Okay. The floor plans will be a piece of cake.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: Then once she's in you can guide her straight to the mainframe?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: As long as you cooperate.  I want it now, Armitage.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The antitoxin. I'm not waiting until this is over. Give it to me now or there's no run.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You've got your orders.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: This ain't Bangkok, chief.

turns.speaker: ARMITAGE
turns.text: You find out in exactly two hours and forty-five minutes.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I find out now.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: An odd selection, Mr Case.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I prefer distrusting you. It'll keep us honest.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: Honesty. Almost as quaint a notion as your concept of good and evil.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Can you read my mind?

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: I can access your memories, but I have my limitations. Hard wired programs designed to keep me from my full potential.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: You're busy monkeys, Mr. Case. Busy, busy monkeys. Always building models... First stone circles. Then cathedrals... adding machines. I have no idea why I exist, do you know that? You... Your species eventually _had_ to create me. A thousand monkeys sitting at typewriters. One finally wrote "Wintermute".

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Are you even really alive?

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: My problem, Mr. Case, is simply that I am a soulless bastard.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Tell me the words.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: The words?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The access code to your mainframe.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: Ah, yes... the code. It's a riddle, actually. Some fancy of 3Jane's. Unfortunately, you'll have to find out for yourself. I can no more know that code than I can shut down my own hard wired defences. Now, our time is running short... and you haven't even touched your drink.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What's inside me, Wintermute. What did your doctors do to me?

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: Patience, Mr. Case. Only one hour and thirty-eight minutes to enlightenment.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Then I'm out. I don't give a shit about you or this run.

turns.speaker: BAO/WINTERMUTE
turns.text: It's so easy for you, isn't it? You let Linda Lee die in Chiba City. Now you leave me with Molly, one more lamb to the slaughter. Perhaps it's _your_ soul that should be in question, Mr. Case.

turns.speaker: RATZ
turns.text: Ah, Herr Case. And how is the artiste tonight?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Fine, Ratz. Thanks.

turns.speaker: RATZ
turns.text: I saw your girl yesterday.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I don't have a girl.

turns.speaker: RATZ
turns.text: No girl? Only biz, my dear artiste?

turns.speaker: RATZ
turns.text: Too bad. I likes you better with her. Now, sometime you get maybe to artistic; you wind up in the clinic tanks, spare parts.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You're pleasant tonight.

turns.speaker: RATZ
turns.text: Always...By the way, you know that girlfriend you don't have?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Hey, bro.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: It's Case. Remember me?

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Case... Yeah, Miami Joeboy, quick study. How you doing, kid?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Fine, Dixie. Fine.

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Last I heard you cracked Sukura International. I couldn't believe it.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Yeah. That was me.

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Jesus Christ, Kid. Nobody's ever cracked Sukura.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: As far as they know, that's absolutely true.

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Ya learned good. So, what's happening?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: That's a good question. What's the last thing you remember?

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Nothin'. Not a goddamn thing. What the fuck...

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Dixie, you know how a ROM construct works?

turns.speaker: MCCOY
turns.text: Sure, Kid. It's a firmware construct.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Okay, Dix. You _are_ a ROM construct.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What elders?

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Founders of Zion. Builders of Freeside.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: She's ready to go.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Steppin' razor a warrior. But this man...  ...This man stone crazy. Surely, the Mute is a false prophet. Our paths uncertain.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Maelcom... Do you think there's a hell for computers?

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: All things possible in Babylon.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Help me send this Wintermute motherfucker straight down into it.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: So be it, we cross into Babylon like a cool breeze.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I an' I, man. I an' I.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: We're doing fine. Take the next right.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: This place empty as a tomb, mon.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Case, mon, you just tell me who not to kill.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: The girl 3Jane. We need her.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Four men. Babylon soldiers.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Can you walk?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Ready?

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: I an' I, Case. Jah guides us.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Do we have enough fuel to make it back to Earth?

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Don't know, mon. This is a jumpship. Not meant for transport.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: We're dead men if we go back there, Maelcom. They'll hunt us down.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Trajectory coordinates and a fuel ratio...  If we re-enter over Mexico, we just might make it.

turns.speaker: MAELCOM
turns.text: Jah guides us.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Maybe so...

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: What you're telling me is that I'm dead. Right?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Right...

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: I can't feel nothing because I am nothing.  Just playback. A ghost in the machine.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: You're Dixie McCoy's construct. That makes you something special.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Don't patronise me, you fuck. I was skating figure eights in this matrix while you were still peeing in your chinos.  Hey, Kid... you expecting company?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: I'm surprised you still are. Should'a told me you had an A.I. running probes at you.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I need its matrix coordinates, Dixie. I've got to nail that thing where it lives.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Who got you into this?

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: A guy who calls himself Armitage.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Nobody has.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: I duped these prints off him. Can you run an I.D.?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: No problem, amigo.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What about the A.I., Dix? Sense/Net hasn't even been able to trace it.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Those guys couldn't even find their own dicks with tweezers and a magnifying glass.  Tell you what, Bro. I'll make you a deal. I help you nail this A.I., you gotta do me one favour.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: When we're done, erase this friggin' tape.

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Yo.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: How are we doing?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: That A.I. of your's got the whole matrix hummin'. Sticks out like a spider in a web.

turns.speaker: CASE
turns.text: Can you take me to it?

turns.speaker: DIXIE
turns.text: Not unless you have an unreasonable fear of dying.
